page.title: 11The History of Shenstone
page.content: Theres quite a few places of history in and around Shenstone. Theres the church built in circa 12th century at the top of St Johns Hill. Theres the Roman building north of Shenstone and Shenstone Court which Henry 8th gave to Stanly. There is also Shenstone Hall which dates back from Jaccobean. Shenstone Court is situated in Court Drive south of the church. Shenstone Court was once called Shenstone Moss and is a big Mansion. Henry 8th granted the huge estate to one Stanly related to the Earl of Derby . Shenstone Hall is another big mansion across the road from the school. There is a date which says 1849. Shenstone hall is still in very good condition. The church is on top of St Johns Hill . DANIEL SPARKES
